original_definition: 'rated capacity' means the cooling or heating capacity of the vapour compression cycle of the unit at standard rating conditions;
generated_definition: 'rated capacity' means the maximum power output of a cooling or heating device under standard rating conditions, as defined in annex ii, table 2.

Article 1: 1.   This Regulation establishes eco-design requirements for the placing on the market of electric mains-operatedair conditioners with arated capacityof ≤ 12 kW for cooling, or heating if the product has no cooling function, andcomfort fans with an electricfan power input ≤ 125W.

1.   This Regulation establishes eco-design requirements for the placing on the market of electric mains-operated air conditioners with a rated capacity of ≤ 12 kW for cooling, or heating if the product has no cooling function, and comfort fans with an electric fan power input ≤ 125W.
Article 2: ‘rated capacity’ (Prated) means the cooling or heating capacity of the vapour compression cycle of the unit at standard rating conditions;
